metadata.synopsis: Postmaster Danzo Arkwright asks the player to find missing letters and will offer a reward on delivery. Reading the letters first will allow the player to blackmail the postmaster.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Teleport to S_WYR_Post_Postmaster and speak to the Postmaster.

2.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
2.text: Deliveries are on hold while we sort out some, er, logistical issues. My apologies.

27.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
27.text: Go on, bugger off. I've a business to run, in case you hadn't noticed.

37.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
37.text: Clear off. I've business to attend to.
37.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound intimidating, but very. very worried

62.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
62.text: Welcome... again... to Sword Coast Couriers - to Send and to Serve. Delivery not guaranteed.

70.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
70.text: If you happen to stumble across those letters, do bring them by. There'd be a tip in it for you.
70.context: NodeContext: Employee spiel. "To Send and to Serve" said proudly, like a company motto. "Delivery not guaranteed" rushed, as though a hidden terms and condition line

98.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
98.text: Welcome to Sword Coast Couriers - to Send and to Serve. Delivery not guaranteed.
98.context: NodeContext: Employee spiel. "To Send and to Serve" said proudly, like a company motto. "Delivery not guaranteed" rushed, as though a hidden terms and condition line

107.speaker: Player
107.text: I'm sorry to tell you - I found the body of one of your couriers. He carried this letter.
107.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands Danzo a letter. Danzo looks at it for a moment, then puts it awayNodeContext: Tutting to himself - another problem to solve

147.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
147.text: Gomwick... that's a real shame. Fine courier, he was.
147.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands Danzo a letter. Danzo looks at it for a moment, then puts it awayNodeContext: Tutting to himself - another problem to solve

58.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
58.text: Stumped how I'll replace him - most want to get into the city these days, not leave it. We've had to cut our courier services completely.
58.context: NodeContext: Knows he doesn't have a leg to stand on

29.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
29.text: I'll tell you, it's left me in a right pickle. I've sent what I can by pigeon, but now something's attacking them and all!
29.context: NodeContext: Knows he doesn't have a leg to stand on

131.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
131.text: 'Become a postmaster, Danzo. It'll be easy.' Nobody mentions having to spend your evenings hunting for pigeon carcasses, do they?
131.context: NodeContext: Knows he doesn't have a leg to stand on

24.speaker: Player
24.text: *You sense there's more to his anxiety than a few missing letters.*
24.context: NodeContext: Knows he doesn't have a leg to stand on

53.text: *You sense there's more to his anxiety than a few missing letters.*
53.context: NodeContext: Knows he doesn't have a leg to stand on

39.speaker: Narrator
39.text: *You sense there's more to his anxiety than a few missing letters.*
39.context: NodeContext: Knows he doesn't have a leg to stand on

113.speaker: Player
113.text: You must be particularly keen to retrieve the Zhentarim letters about the Iron Flask.
113.context: NodeContext: Knows he doesn't have a leg to stand on

99.speaker: Player
99.text: Level with me. What's really going on here?
99.context: NodeContext: Knows he doesn't have a leg to stand on

78.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
78.text: Oh, well, er, one of the missing letters is my own correspondence.
78.context: NodeContext: Knows he doesn't have a leg to stand on

115.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
115.text: A personal matter. Nothing serious. But you can understand, if people think I can't even deliver my own letters, I'd be finished!
115.context: NodeContext: Knows he doesn't have a leg to stand on

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Especially if they discovered you were meddling in Guild business on the Zhentarim's behalf.
42.context: NodeContext: Knows he doesn't have a leg to stand on

18.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
18.text: You - you read it? Technically that's interfering with someone else's property. I should report you to the nearest manip.
18.context: NodeContext: Knows he doesn't have a leg to stand on

34.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
34.text: Tell you what - give it here and we'll say no more about it.
34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Danzo beckons for the player to hand the letters overNodeContext: nervous but acting like this is doing you a favour

137.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
137.text: I'll give you a nice little bonus as well. A finder's fee. What do you say?
137.context: NodeContext: Desperate, trying to act casual

142.speaker: Player
142.text: I've got another buyer lined up. I'd make it a very generous fee.
142.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands letters to Danzo

25.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
25.text: Fine. Just give me the letter.
25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands letters to Danzo

148.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
148.text: Fine. Just give me the letter.
148.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands letters to Danzo

69.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
69.text: Forget you saw anything. This never happened.

0.text: If you'd shown that letter to anyone but the Zhent, you'd already be dead.

130.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
130.text: If you'd shown that letter to anyone but the Zhent, you'd already be dead.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Give me everything the Zhentarim paid you, or this letter is the least of your worries.
73.context: NodeContext: Steely, about to start a combat with you.

22.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
22.text: You really think I'm intimidated by the likes of you?
22.context: NodeContext: Steely, about to start a combat with you.

104.text: You really think I'm intimidated by the likes of you?
104.context: NodeContext: Steely, about to start a combat with you.

93.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
93.text: You really think I'm intimidated by the likes of you?
93.context: NodeContext: Steely, about to start a combat with you.

91.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
91.text: That letter's not leaving this room. Neither are you.
91.context: NodeContext: Steely, about to start a combat with you.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: It'd be a shame if anyone told the Zhentarim you lost this. A real shame...
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands Danzo the letters

5.speaker: Player
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands Danzo the letters

140.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
140.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands Danzo the letters

82.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
82.text: Here's your fee. Our little secret, all right?

83.speaker: Player
83.text: No, thanks. I'm keeping the letter.

71.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
71.text: You bloody arse rat. Fine - keep it. Much good it'll do you.

97.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
97.text: Go on, get out of my post house. We're closed.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: Is this the letter you were looking for?
119.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands Danzo the letters (unseen)

17.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
17.text: Ah. You've opened it, I see.
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands Danzo the letters (unseen)

109.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
109.text: Well, let's cut to the chase. Go on. Tell me how much your silence is going to cost me.
109.context: CinematicNodeContext: Danzo pays the playerNodeContext: Suddenly businesslike, his charm vanished

121.speaker: Player
121.text: Erm, give me all of your gold. Or I start breaking fingers.
121.context: CinematicNodeContext: Danzo hands over gold (unseen)NodeContext: Reluctant, scared you'll get him in trouble

146.text: Fine. Take it all, and keep your trap shut.
146.context: CinematicNodeContext: Danzo hands over gold (unseen)NodeContext: Reluctant, scared you'll get him in trouble

35.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
35.text: Fine. Take it all, and keep your trap shut.
35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Danzo hands over gold (unseen)NodeContext: Reluctant, scared you'll get him in trouble

103.speaker: Player
103.text: Everything you have. It will take a lot of gold to make me forget that horrible letter I definitely read.
103.context: NodeContext: Realising the player is lying to them

48.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
48.text: You... you didn't read it, did you?
48.context: NodeContext: Realising the player is lying to them

123.text: You... you didn't read it, did you?
123.context: NodeContext: Realising the player is lying to them

66.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
66.text: You... you didn't read it, did you?
66.context: NodeContext: Realising the player is lying to them

112.speaker: Player
112.text: I didn't read it. I'm not here to blackmail you.
112.context: CinematicNodeContext: Danzo hands the player some gold (unseen)

136.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
136.text: You aren't? Right. Well, er, here's a little something anyway. A gift.
136.context: CinematicNodeContext: Danzo hands the player some gold (unseen)

57.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
57.text: Let's not mention this to anyone else. Our little secret, all right?

120.speaker: Player
120.text: Is this the letter you were looking for?
120.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands letters to Danzo (unseen. Danzo inspects the letters, then puts them away (unseen)NodeContext: Palpable relief

52.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
52.text: Thank the gods! Unopened as well. Oh, what a relief. My customers will be most pleased.
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands letters to Danzo (unseen. Danzo inspects the letters, then puts them away (unseen)NodeContext: Palpable relief

43.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
43.context: CinematicNodeContext:  Danzo hands the player some gold (unseen)

128.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
128.text: Please, take this. You've earned it ten times over.
128.context: CinematicNodeContext: Danzo hands the player some gold (unseen)

101.speaker: Player
101.text: Any idea where the birds went missing?
101.context: NodeContext: Very hesitant - torn between needing the letters found, and fear that you'll read them

61.speaker: Player
61.text: Do you want me to track down your letter?
61.context: NodeContext: Very hesitant - torn between needing the letters found, and fear that you'll read them

80.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
80.text: You'd do that? Well, if it's not too much bother I - yes, I'd appreciate the help.
80.context: NodeContext: Very hesitant - torn between needing the letters found, and fear that you'll read them

54.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
54.text: Bring me the letter - unopened, of course - and I'll happily compensate you for your troubles.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: I can track this letter down. But I'll need my expenses paid up front.
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Danzo hands the player some money (unseen)NodeContext: flustered, trying not to sound too desperate

72.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
72.text: I suppose there's no harm in you taking a look. Here's something to get you started.
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Danzo hands the player some money (unseen)NodeContext: flustered, trying not to sound too desperate

129.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
129.text: I suppose there's no harm in you taking a look. Here's something to get you started.
129.context: CinematicNodeContext: Danzo hands the player some money (unseen)NodeContext: flustered, trying not to sound too desperate

88.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
88.text: Bring me the letter - unopened - and you'll get the rest.

96.text: I'll pay when that letter's on my counter, unopened. Not one moment before.
96.context: NodeContext: Jocular scolding, putting an end to the discussion

14.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
14.text: I'll pay when that letter's on my counter, unopened. Not one moment before.
14.context: NodeContext: Jocular scolding, putting an end to the discussion

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Any idea where the birds went missing?
86.context: NodeContext: Hiding his panic - it might be life and death for him

56.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
56.text: Not the foggiest. Normally they fly true as an elven arrow.

116.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
116.text: Something nearby is snatching them, I can tell you that much.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: I could find the pigeons for you. My fees are very reasonable.
143.context: NodeContext: Hiding his panic - it might be life and death for him

7.speaker: Player
7.text: I'd be happy to take a look.
7.context: NodeContext: Hiding his panic - it might be life and death for him

108.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
108.text: Well, er, if it's not too much trouble, I'd be much obliged.

47.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
47.text: Any letters you find, bring them back to me - unopened, of course - and there's some gold in it for you.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Good luck with that. I've got bigger problems to solve.
49.context: NodeContext: Hiding his panic - it might be life and death for him

28.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
28.text: I'm sure you do. What's a few letters gone astray at a time like this? Hardly life and death, is it?
28.context: NodeContext: Hiding his panic - it might be life and death for him

40.speaker: Player
40.context: NodeContext: Jolly, as if this is just a run-of-the-mill problem

74.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
74.text: Well, we've had to change the policy. Hard to send letters by road when there's a rampaging army of fanatics bearing down on you.
74.context: NodeContext: Jolly, as if this is just a run-of-the-mill problem

125.speaker: Player
125.text: I'm not sending anything. You can drop the sales routine.
125.context: NodeContext: Not rising to the allegation, staying positive

55.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
55.text: No routine here - we're the best in the city, delivering from Candlekeep to Waterdeep and beyond!
55.context: NodeContext: Not rising to the allegation, staying positive

77.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
77.text: At least, normally that's the case. We've had to limit our service - hard to send letters by road when there's a rampaging army of fanatics bearing down on you.
77.context: NodeContext: Bragging, then hesitantly admitting there's a problem

127.speaker: Player
127.text: It's rare to meet someone so cheerful these days. Why the good mood?
127.context: NodeContext: Obnoxiously bright and cheerful customer service

144.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
144.text: I'm alive and well, aren't I? Earning an honest living. Serving my community. I've plenty to be happy about.

114.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
114.text: Though, I will admit it's been tough recently. We've had to cut down our courier routes. Too risky with that army rampaging nearby.
114.context: NodeContext: Trying to sound positive, actually unsettled/nervous about this

126.speaker: Player
126.text: Still need help tracking down those letters?

31.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
31.text: I do, as a matter of fact. Would you be interested in lending a hand?

110.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
110.text: I don't suppose you've, er, stumbled across those letters yet?
110.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands over the letters to DanzoNodeContext: snappy, betraying his stress

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I found a different letter. It was on the body of one of your employees.
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands over the letters to DanzoNodeContext: snappy, betraying his stress

9.speaker: Player
9.text: I found the letter intended for the Zhentarim. It made for very interesting reading.
9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands over the letters to DanzoNodeContext: snappy, betraying his stress

26.speaker: Player
26.text: I found the letter, but it was very difficult. I'm afraid my fees have gone up.
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands over the letters to DanzoNodeContext: snappy, betraying his stress

79.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
79.text: Yes, fine, just give me the letters.
79.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands over the letters to DanzoNodeContext: snappy, betraying his stress

68.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
68.text: Yes, fine, just give me the letters.
68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player hands over the letters to DanzoNodeContext: snappy, betraying his stress

111.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
111.text: You've no idea the kindness you've done me. What a relief!

60.text: And I'm afraid my offer has stayed the same. Give me the letters, please.

134.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
134.text: And I'm afraid my offer has stayed the same. Give me the letters, please.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: On second thoughts, I think I'll hang on to them.

100.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
100.text: Much appreciated. They'll turn up in the last place you look, I'm sure!

84.speaker: Player
84.text: I'm afraid the letters have been destroyed.

6.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
6.text: Better than having them fall into the wrong hands, but still totally unacceptable.

138.speaker: Danzo Arkwright
138.text: Welcome to Sword Coast Couriers - to Send and to Serve. Delivery guaranteed.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: I'm sorry to tell you - I found the body of one of your couriers. He carried this letter.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: I'm not sending anything. You can drop the sales routine.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: It's rare to meet someone so cheerful these days. Why the good mood?
